definitions.definition: Any of the manners by which living beings perceive the physical world: for humans sight , smell , hearing , touch , taste .
Perception through the intellect; apprehension ; awareness .

examples: It’s common sense not to put metal objects in a microwave oven.

definitions.definition: The meaning , reason , or value of something.

subdefinitions.definition: A meaning of a term ( word or expression ), among its various meanings.
examples: the various senses of the word “car” (e.g., motor car, elevator car, railcar)

subdefinitions.definition: A single conventional use of a word; one of the entries or definitions for a word in a dictionary.

definitions.definition: The way that a referent is presented.
One of two opposite directions in which a vector (especially of motion) may point. See also polarity .
One of two opposite directions of rotation, clockwise versus anti-clockwise .
referring to the strand of a nucleic acid that directly specifies the product.

main_definition: Any of the manners by which living beings perceive the physical world: for humans sight , smell , hearing , touch , taste .
secondary_definitions: Perception through the intellect; apprehension ; awareness .
The meaning , reason , or value of something.
( pragmatics ) The way that a referent is presented.
( mathematics ) One of two opposite directions in which a vector (especially of motion) may point. See also polarity .
( mathematics ) One of two opposite directions of rotation, clockwise versus anti-clockwise .
( biochemistry ) referring to the strand of a nucleic acid that directly specifies the product.
